title: Warren Gatland keen to go back to New Zealand with head held high as Wales are challenged to 'do something special'
text:
On a monsoon day in Tokyo, Warren Gatland imagined himself back on Waihi Beach in New Zealand as a World Cup winner for a nation of four regional clubs sides and 3.2 million people.

"I’m not sure the WRU [Welsh Rugby Union] would let me take the World Cup back to New Zealand," Gatland said as he absorbed the blow of losing Liam Williams for the South Africa semi-final. Alongside him sat another titan of Welsh rugby - captain Alun Wyn Jones - on a poignant preview day. Two great careers are crying out for the glory of Wales making it through to their first World Cup final.

Adversity...
